New York University Archives
Vox Vet
New York University
RG.39.192
.25 Linear Feet in four folders
1946-1948 This collection contains issues from the student newspaper the Vox Vet dating from 1946 to 1948. This newspaper was published by the NYU branch of the Veterans Collegiate Association and documented issues that were relevant to students who were or had served in World War Two. This includes documenting student clubs, campus life, local and national news, and advice on matters such as health insurance. The collection is extensive but not comprehensive, there may be some issues that were published but are not included in this collection. Materials in English.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Arrangement
Newspapers are arranged chronologically.
Biographical / Historical
New York University has had many student newspapers since its founding. The University Heights campus and the Washington Square campus had separate student newspapers until 1973 when the University Heights campus was closed.
Preferred Citation
Published citations should take the following form: Identification of item, date; Vox Vet; RG 39.192; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University Libraries.
Scope and Contents
This collection contains issues from the student newspaper the Vox Vet dating from 1946 to 1948. This newspaper was published by the NYU branch of the Veterans Collegiate Association and documented issues that were relevant to students who were or had served in World War Two. This includes documenting student clubs, campus life, local and national news, and advice on matters such as health insurance. The collection is extensive but not comprehensive, there may be some issues that were published but are not included in this collection.
Conditions Governing Use
This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Materials found in collection; there is no documentation concerning the provenance of these materials.
College student newspapers and periodicals. Veterans World War, 1939-1945. Washington Square College New York University. University Heights
